title: OgNasty
author: OgNasty
content: I know that Ravencoin was supposed to be a securities platform of sorts and was designed for users to be able to purchase a ticker symbol.  My question is if these are actually traded anywhere?  Is anyone actually using these for anything?  With Ravencoin's sudden rise in popularity from ETH 2.0's PoW demise, it seems like people might be looking into these names and maybe starting to create some projects using them.  Is there a central place where this sort of activity is taking place?

comments.author: ahmia39
comments.body: Reporting from the official website ravencoin.org, Ravencoin is a peer-to-peer blockchain, handling the efficient creation and transfer of assets from one party to another.Ravencoin is a protocol based on a Bitcoin code fork that adds features that are specifically, focused on enabling tokens to be issued on the Ravencoin blockchain.These tokens can have any property the owner decides – so they can be limited in number, named, and issued as securities or as collectibles.According to Ravencoin.org, you can create your own security token in minutes and trade it worldwide.
